id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.name.description: The full official name of the Profile as used in their branding and documentation.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.profileT.description: The primary operational category or business model of the Profile (e.g. DAO, project, investor, government). Refer to standardized list of Profile types.

possible_values.definition: not_set

possible_values.name: DAO
possible_values.definition: A group of individuals with a flattened hierarchy for decision-making and operational execution using blockchain technology.

possible_values.name: Company
possible_values.definition: A profile with a for-profit mandate or a business plan aimed at generating revenue.

possible_values.name: NFT Collection
possible_values.definition: A set of unique digital art items, typically created by a single creator or themed to include works from multiple creators.

possible_values.name: Project
possible_values.definition: An organization with an undefined objective, purpose, or offering.

possible_values.name: Investor
possible_values.definition: A profile primarily focused on raising and deploying funds to generate returns on the initial investment.

possible_values.name: Government
possible_values.definition: An organization or agency exercising political authority in the interests of its residents or constituents.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.profileS.description: The primary industry, use case, or problem space the Profile operates in or serves. Refer to standardized list of sectors and subsectors.

possible_values.definition: not_set

possible_values.name: Finance
possible_values.definition: The sector encompassing activities related to the trading, exchanging, or management of fungible assets, such as cryptocurrencies, tokens, or other digital assets, within the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem.

possible_values.name: Payments
possible_values.definition: The sector involving services or platforms that facilitate the transfer of cryptocurrencies or other digital assets from one person or entity to another, often in exchange for goods or services within the decentralized economy.

possible_values.name: Insurance
possible_values.definition: The sector dealing with smart contracts or dApps that provide protection for digital assets, on-chain activities, and blockchain-based investments.

possible_values.name: Asset Management
possible_values.definition: The sector that includes tools, products, or services that allow users to securely store, manage, and interact with their digital assets, such as cryptocurrencies and tokens, within the blockchain ecosystem. Examples include wallets and portfolio management.

possible_values.name: Developer Tooling
possible_values.definition: The sector comprising services, products, and frameworks that support developers in designing, building, and deploying dApps and smart contracts on blockchain platforms.

possible_values.name: Gaming
possible_values.definition: The sector that encompasses dApps and platforms that offer interactive entertainment experiences, often integrating blockchain technology for asset ownership, rewards, and in-game economies.

possible_values.name: Infrastructure
possible_values.definition: The sector comprising foundational technologies, protocols, and services that enable the operation and interoperability of blockchain networks and dApps. Examples include nodes, staking mechanisms, and cross-chain solutions.

possible_values.name: Blockchain Platforms
possible_values.definition: The sector consisting of decentralized platforms and frameworks that allow developers to build, deploy, and interact with smart contracts and dApps. Examples include Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Solana.

possible_values.name: Supply chain
possible_values.definition: The sector that leverages blockchain technology to enhance the transparency, traceability, and efficiency of the movement of physical goods, including fast-moving consumer goods, across decentralized supply chain networks.

possible_values.name: Data & Analytics
possible_values.definition: The sector encompassing services, APIs, and platforms that provide reliable and tamper-proof data, statistics, and insights for the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem. This includes oracles and data providers that feed off-chain information to smart contracts.

possible_values.name: NFTs
possible_values.definition: The sector revolving around NFTs, which are unique digital assets stored on a blockchain. This includes NFT marketplaces, creation tools, and platforms that facilitate the minting, trading, and collection of these unique digital items.

possible_values.name: Healthcare
possible_values.definition: The sector exploring the application of blockchain technology and decentralized solutions to improve the security, privacy, and interoperability of healthcare data and services, enabling patient-centric approaches and secure data sharing.

possible_values.name: Science
possible_values.definition: The sector focused on leveraging blockchain technology and decentralized networks to advance scientific research, collaboration, and funding. This includes projects that aim to democratize access to scientific data, tools, and resources.

possible_values.name: Security
possible_values.definition: The sector dedicated to enhancing the safety and resilience of blockchain networks, smart contracts, and dApps through advanced cryptographic techniques, and best practices.

possible_values.name: Auditing
possible_values.definition: The sector specializing in the methodological review and verification of blockchain projects, smart contracts, and dApps to ensure their security, reliability, and adherence to best practices and standards.

possible_values.name: Mining
possible_values.definition: The sector involved in the process of validating transactions and adding new blocks to a blockchain network, typically through PoW consensus mechanisms. This includes mining hardware, software, and pool services.

possible_values.name: Metaverse
possible_values.definition: The sector at the intersection of blockchain technology and immersive virtual worlds, where users can interact with digital assets, participate in decentralized economies, and experience new forms of social engagement and creativity.

possible_values.name: Venture Capital
possible_values.definition: The sector focused on investing in and supporting the growth of promising blockchain and Web3 projects, startups, and ecosystems through strategic funding, mentorship, and partnerships.

possible_values.name: Media
possible_values.definition: Includes news websites, image sites and video hosting websites.

possible_values.name: Meme
possible_values.definition: The sector that contains all things meme related.

possible_values.name: Social
possible_values.definition: Anything to do with social media, social interactions

possible_values.name: Community & Events
possible_values.definition: The sector that acts as a catch all around groups of people or gatherings that are focused on Web3 & Blockchain but may not have a specific technical product

possible_values.name: Service Provider
possible_values.definition: Offers specialized services to the the Web3 ecosystem which are not covered by the other sectors. These include technical (development, infrastructure), business (marketing, PR, design), financial (accounting, tax), education (training and certifications) legal, consulting, and administrative services.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.profileS.description: The current operational state of the Profile (e.g. Active, Inactive, Closed). Refer to the standardized list of status options.

possible_values.definition: not_set

possible_values.name: Announced
possible_values.definition: The profile's information is public, but with limited one-way interaction (e.g., newsletter subscription, social media following), or all product(s)/service(s) are not yet available.

possible_values.name: Active
possible_values.definition: The profile's offering allows for successful two-way interaction (e.g., using the product/service, building on the blockchain), or the profile maintains a functioning product.

possible_values.name: Inactive
possible_values.definition: Interactions with the profile's service/product are frequently unsuccessful, or the service/product is no longer supported or actively developed. All socials are invalid or suspended with no other way to contact or follow the project (no blog or up-to-date documentation), even when interaction with the product is still possible.

possible_values.name: Closed
possible_values.definition: Interaction with the profile's offering is no longer possible, or the entity has announced the profile's closure.

possible_values.name: Acquired
possible_values.definition: The profile has been purchased by or merged with another company/protocol.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.founding.description: The date when the Profile was first established, registered, or publicly announced. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible. Can usually be shortened to Month and Year.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.logo.description: A PNG or SVG image file representing the Profile's logo, with a transparent background and a minimum resolution of 256x256 pixels.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.descript.description: Provide an objective overview of the Profile's primary purpose, product, or service. Avoid subjective claims, marketing language, or unnecessary technical jargon. Focus on clear, factual information. Limit to 200 characters.
A more detailed overview of the Profile, including its mission, target audience, and key features or offerings. Limit to 500 characters and avoid subjective claims.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.profileInfos.tagLine.description: A brief, memorable phrase or slogan used by the Profile to convey its mission or value proposition. If the tagline is in all caps or contains irregular spaces or line breaks, reformat it to a single line, single spaced, and sentence case. Only use a full stop in a tagline if the original source uses one.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.name.description: The official name of the Asset as used in its branding, marketing, and trading materials.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.ticker.description: The unique trading symbol used to represent the Asset on exchanges and trading platforms. Use only capital letters and numbers.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.icon.description: A square PNG but ideally an SVG image file representing the Asset's icon or logo, with a transparent background and a minimum resolution of 128x128 pixels.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.shortDescripti.description: A concise, one-sentence summary of the Asset's key characteristics, use case, or value proposition. Limit to 200 characters and avoid subjective claims.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.assetTypes.description: The primary category or function of the Asset (e.g. Currency, Utility, Security) and what is does.

possible_values.definition: not set

possible_values.name: Currency
possible_values.definition: General cryptocurrency used for payment or investment purposes.

possible_values.name: NFT
possible_values.definition: Unique token usually representing a piece of art, often part of a collection.

possible_values.name: Memecoin
possible_values.definition: A token that has little to no utility, often stemming from an online cultural movement, event or happenstance.

possible_values.name: Utility
possible_values.definition: A token required to take action or redeem services within a specific system.

possible_values.name: Governance
possible_values.definition: A token required for decision-making within a protocol or entity.

possible_values.name: Security
possible_values.definition: A token clearly marked to represent a fungible financial instrument.

possible_values.name: Stablecoin
possible_values.definition: A token often pegged to a fiat currency or traditional commodity.

possible_values.name: Digital Reward Assets
possible_values.definition: Virtual currencies or points issued by platforms, programs, or games that can be exchanged for cryptocurrencies, NFTs, fiat money, or other real-world assets. These assets represent value within a specific ecosystem but may adopt broader utility.

possible_values.name: Programmatic Asset Derivative
possible_values.definition: Represents another asset while adding new features through smart contracts. It maintains a direct relationship with their original asset through code, usually requiring that asset to be locked up as backing. It includes staked tokens, LSTs, LRTs, wrapped, and synthetic assets.

possible_values.name: Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs)
possible_values.definition: Tokens that represent staked assets while maintaining liquidity, allowing holders to earn staking rewards and simultaneously use the tokens in DeFi applications.

possible_values.name: Restaked Tokens
possible_values.definition: Tokens created when staked assets (often LSTs) are redeployed to secure additional protocols, enabling the same asset to generate multiple revenue streams.

possible_values.name: Wrapped Tokens
possible_values.definition: One-to-one representations of assets from other blockchains, enabling cross-chain functionality while maintaining direct backing by the original asset.

possible_values.name: Synthetic Assets
possible_values.definition: Smart contract-based tokens that track and mirror the price of other assets (crypto or traditional) without requiring direct ownership of the underlying asset.

possible_values.name: Bridged Tokens
possible_values.definition: Cross-chain token representations created when assets are locked on their original chain and reissued on a target chain through bridging protocols.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.address.description: The unique smart contract address of the Asset on the blockchain it is deployed on. Use a standard blockchain explorer to validate the address.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.profile.description: A reference to the Profile associated with the Asset, using the Profile's unique identifier or name.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.assetStatus.description: The current development or access stage of the asset. Refer to the standardized list of asset status options.

possible_values.name: In Development
possible_values.definition: The asset has been announced but is not yet launched or fully implemented. It's still in the creation or testing phase.

possible_values.name: Active
possible_values.definition: The asset is currently in use, tradable, and fully functional within its intended ecosystem. Regular updates and transactions are occurring.

possible_values.name: Inactive
possible_values.definition: The asset is not currently active in the ecosystem, either due to ceased development or lack of usage. No recent updates or significant trading activity.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.assets.assetSupportTy.description: A classification of the functional relationship between a product and an asset, indicating how the asset is utilized within the product's operations.

possible_values.definition: Not set

possible_values.name: Native
possible_values.definition: A core asset of the protocol behind this product (e.g., BTC for the Bitcoin Network)

possible_values.name: Supports
possible_values.definition: This asset has functionality within this product (e.g., tradable assets in a DEX)

possible_values.name: Governance
possible_values.definition: The main governance asset for this product (e.g., UNI for Uniswap)

possible_values.name: Managed by
possible_values.definition: The asset is managed by this product

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.name.description: The official name of the product as used in its branding, marketing, and user-facing materials.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.productType.description: The primary category or function of the product (e.g. exchange, wallet, lending platform). Refer to standardized list of product types.

possible_values.definition: not_set

possible_values.name: L1
possible_values.definition: A base layer blockchain that acts as the lowest settlement layer. Examples include Bitcoin or Ethereum.

possible_values.name: L2
possible_values.definition: A blockchain that inherits security from another L1 blockchain, often with the intent to improve either scaling, speed or cost.

possible_values.name: L3
possible_values.definition: A blockchain built on a L2, often with a specific objective or function.

possible_values.name: Oracle
possible_values.definition: Takes off chain data and makes it available on chain.

possible_values.name: Hardware Wallet
possible_values.definition: A private key manager that requires physical equipment in order for users to interact with their onchain assets.

possible_values.name: Bridge
possible_values.definition: An application used to port assets from one blockchain to another.

possible_values.name: Bridge Aggregator
possible_values.definition: An application that collects many different applications for the purpose of porting assets.

possible_values.name: Decentralised Exchange
possible_values.definition: A protocol that enables the trading of cryptocurrencies directly between users without the need for a central authority.

possible_values.name: DEX Aggregator
possible_values.definition: A service that scans multiple decentralised exchanges, often to compare prices and liquidity for trading pairs.

possible_values.name: Centralised Exchange
possible_values.definition: A platform where cryptocurrencies are traded through an authority or mediator that facilitates the transactions and often provides wallet services.

possible_values.name: On/Off Ramp
possible_values.definition: Services that allow for the conversion between cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies, facilitating entry and exit points into the crypto market.

possible_values.name: FinOps Tooling
possible_values.definition: Financial operations tools for managing spending and monetary administration efficiently (e.g., "accounting”). Example: www.request.finance

possible_values.name: Decentralised Borrowing & Lending
possible_values.definition: A peer-to-peer financial system on the blockchain that allows users to collateralize digital assets without the need for a central authority.

possible_values.name: Centralised Borrowing & Lending
possible_values.definition: Platforms operated by mediating entities that facilitate the collateralization of digital assets, often with added features like interest accounts.

possible_values.name: Offchain Insurance
possible_values.definition: Products and contracts that provide coverage for crypto-related risks and events, processed outside the blockchain.

possible_values.name: Onchain Insurance
possible_values.definition: Products and contracts that provide coverage for crypto-related risks and events, executed automatically on the blockchain.

possible_values.name: Pricing Data API
possible_values.definition: A service providing real-time and historical financial information for cryptocurrencies from various markets for integration into apps and services.

possible_values.name: OnChain Data API
possible_values.definition: A service offering developers direct access to information stored on a blockchain, usually for the purpose of building applications on it.

possible_values.name: Game
possible_values.definition: Interactive digital entertainment designed on blockchain technology, often incorporating cryptocurrencies, NFTs, play to earn or tokenized assets for in-game transactions and ownership.

possible_values.name: NFT Marketplace
possible_values.definition: An online platform where unique digital assets can be bought, sold or traded.

possible_values.name: NFT Issuance Platform
possible_values.definition: A service that allows users to create and issue their own unique digital assets, typically involving digital art or collectibles.

possible_values.name: News & Media
possible_values.definition: Creates, curates, or distributes Web3 content in various formats. It delivers research or information on market trends, tech news, and regulations while facilitating user engagement. It may use blockchain for content rights management and monetization. It includes subscription-based products.

possible_values.name: RWA Tokenisation Platform
possible_values.definition: A platform that enables the conversion of rights to a physical asset into a digital token on a blockchain.

possible_values.name: Liquid Staking
possible_values.definition: A form of securing a blockchain that involves locking up participants’ onchain assets, and the participants receive an asset in return that can be spent, traded or exchanged like any other fungible asset.

possible_values.name: Derivatives
possible_values.definition: Financial contracts on the blockchain whose value is based on the performance of an underlying digital asset, allowing for hedging, speculation, or access to new markets.

possible_values.name: Stablecoin Issuance
possible_values.definition: The process of creating and managing digital currencies pegged to traditional assets like fiat money or gold to reduce volatility in the crypto market.

possible_values.name: Music
possible_values.definition: Blockchain-based platforms that enable creators to tokenize, sell, and manage rights to their music, ensuring fair compensation and distribution.

possible_values.name: Node Software
possible_values.definition: Enables a computer to participate in a blockchain network by maintaining and validating activity on the blockchain. This also includes node hosting services that enable you to run your own node.

possible_values.name: Pool Software
possible_values.definition: Enables the aggregation of computational resources or liquidity from multiple participants, commonly used in DeFi protocols for staking, mining or liquidity provision.

possible_values.name: Custody Technology Provider
possible_values.definition: A company that offers solutions for the secure storage and management of digital assets.

possible_values.name: Custodian
possible_values.definition: An entity responsible for holding and safeguarding a client's securities or assets to prevent theft or loss.

possible_values.name: DAO Management Platform
possible_values.definition: Provides tools for the creation, administration and governance of entities that have a flattened hierarchy for decision-making and operating.

possible_values.name: Internet of Things (IoT)
possible_values.definition: Facilitates secure, decentralized communication and transactions between connected devices with the integration of blockchain technology.

possible_values.name: Trading Terminal
possible_values.definition: A comprehensive platform or interface providing real-time data, analysis tools, and trading capabilities across various cryptocurrencies and digital stores of value.

possible_values.name: RPC Provider
possible_values.definition: A service that offers Remote Procedure Call (RPC) endpoints, allowing developers and applications to interact with blockchain networks without running a full node.

possible_values.name: Block Explorer
possible_values.definition: A tool that allows you to interact with onchain information or explore data.

possible_values.name: Data
possible_values.definition: A catch all term for data services, providers that are not specific onchain data sets.

possible_values.name: Multi-Sig Wallet
possible_values.definition: A cryptocurrency wallet that requires multiple private keys to authorize a transaction, enhancing security by distributing control among multiple parties.

possible_values.name: Wallet
possible_values.definition: A software application or hardware device that stores private keys and allows users to send, receive, and manage their cryptocurrency assets.

possible_values.name: Launch Pad
possible_values.definition: A platform that facilitates the initial offering and distribution of new cryptocurrency tokens, often providing a streamlined process for projects to raise funds and for investors to participate in early-stage token sales.

possible_values.name: Yield Aggregator
possible_values.definition: A tool to the process of deploying assets and collecting the rewards on behalf of users.

possible_values.name: Compute Network
possible_values.definition: A product that provides decentralized computational resources for specific tasks, such as AI training, graphical rendering, or confidential computing.

possible_values.name: Gambling/Casino
possible_values.definition: A blockchain-based platform that offers games of chance or skill where users can wager cryptocurrency or tokens. These platforms typically leverage smart contracts for transparency and provable fairness in game outcomes.

possible_values.name: Dust Collector
possible_values.definition: Collects small parts of assets and may convert them

possible_values.name: Trading Bot
possible_values.definition: A bot, ususally in a chat app such as telegram, that enables its users to trade digital assets

possible_values.name: Shared Sequencer
possible_values.definition: A specialized blockchain infrastructure component that orders and batches transactions for multiple chains, rollups, or applications.

possible_values.name: Messaging Protocol
possible_values.definition: A decentralized communication infrastructure that enables secure, private, and often censorship-resistant exchange of messages between users or applications.

possible_values.name: Risk Assessment
possible_values.definition: A product or service that identifies, analyzes, and evaluates potential threats and vulnerabilities in blockchain systems, smart contracts, and crypto operations.

possible_values.name: Prediction Markets
possible_values.definition: A place to make predictions on events that tend to be settled onchain.

possible_values.name: Payments Infrastructure
possible_values.definition: A system or platform that facilitates financial transactions and payment processing within the blockchain ecosystem, supporting various payment methods and asset types. This includes physical and digital debit and rewards cards.

possible_values.name: Decentralised Identity
possible_values.definition: Includes identity solutions that may follow DID standards or are products to do with issuing identity on blockchain networks.

possible_values.name: Social Platform
possible_values.definition: An application or service that facilitates online community building and social interactions, incorporating or supporting blockchain-based features such as tokenized incentives, decentralized identity, or content ownership.

possible_values.name: Cross-chain Infrastructure
possible_values.definition: Solutions that enable interoperability, communication, or asset transfers between different blockchain networks, facilitating cross-chain operations and ecosystem connectivity.

possible_values.name: Blockchain Gaming Infrastructure
possible_values.definition: Tools, frameworks, and platforms that enable the development and integration of blockchain technology into games, facilitating features such as in-game economies, digital asset ownership, and decentralized gameplay mechanics.

possible_values.name: Transport
possible_values.definition: A product that helps move things or people from A -> B

possible_values.name: Developer Tooling
possible_values.definition: SDKs, frameworks, APIs, or services designed to facilitate the creation, testing, deployment, or integration of blockchain applications or transactions.

possible_values.name: DePin
possible_values.definition: A catch all term for products that provide decentralised physical infrastructure (i.e., hardware rental)

possible_values.name: Staking Infra
possible_values.definition: Tools that help development teams run staking for their own teams

possible_values.name: Market Maker
possible_values.definition: A centralised service that provides liquidity to markets by continuously buying and selling assets, helping to ensure price stability and market efficiency in both centralized and decentralized environments. This does not refer to Automated Market Makers (AMMs) within DEXes.

possible_values.name: Mobile Phone
possible_values.definition: A communication device that is often mobile. Often fits in ones hand and connected to the internet.

possible_values.name: Grants Platform
possible_values.definition: A platform that enables companies or projects to create, issue and manage grants. Could also be a grant aggregator, may also be a jobs board but generally is focused on grants.

possible_values.name: Impact Initiative
possible_values.definition: A project or platform designed to facilitate philanthropic endeavors and create positive social or environmental change. This includes charitable activities, donations, conservation efforts, and art initiatives.

possible_values.name: Events & Conferences
possible_values.definition: A organized gathering or series of gatherings including conferences, summits, hackathons, and workshops that facilitate knowledge sharing, networking, skill development, or innovation. These events may be in-person, virtual, or hybrid.

possible_values.name: Venture Services
possible_values.definition: Specialized financial and support services, including venture capital, investment funds, accelerators, and incubators that provide funding, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities to early-stage blockchain projects and startups.  Currently acts as a catch all for VC related activity.

possible_values.name: Decentralized File Storage
possible_values.definition: A blockchain-based network or protocol that enables distributed storage and retrieval of digital files across multiple nodes.

possible_values.name: Customer Engagement Platform
possible_values.definition: Enables interaction with, management, and nurturing of customer relationships. Includes customer data management, communication tools, loyalty programs, analytics, and automation.

possible_values.name: Service Provider
possible_values.definition: Offers specialized services to the the Web3 ecosystem which are not covered by the other product types. These include technical (development, infrastructure), business (marketing, PR, design), financial (accounting, tax), education (training and certifications) legal, consulting, and administrative services.

possible_values.name: Staking Data
possible_values.definition: Data about staking across various networks, most often to do with networks that require nodes to do some form of staking.

possible_values.name: Onchain Compliance and investigations
possible_values.definition: Tools that have a focus on, onchain compliance and conducting legal investigations

possible_values.name: Data Terminal
possible_values.definition: A comprehensive platform or interface providing real-time data and analysis tools, across various cryptocurrencies and digital stores of value.

possible_values.name: AI Agent
possible_values.definition: A software program that uses artificial intelligence to autonomously execute specific tasks or make decisions within a blockchain ecosystem. For trading bots, please select the dedicated product type.

possible_values.name: AI Agent Platform
possible_values.definition: A system that enables the creation, deployment, and management of multiple AI agents within a blockchain context. Provides infrastructure and tools for agent operation.

possible_values.name: Browser
possible_values.definition: A web browser with integrated blockchain and cryptocurrency capabilities that enables users to interact with decentralized applications, manage digital assets, and access Web3 services.

possible_values.name: AI Agent Framework
possible_values.definition: A self hosted way to build AI agents.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.description.description: A concise, objective statement explaining what the product does and who it is for.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.productStatu.description: The current development or access stage of the product (e.g. Beta, Live, Deprecated).

possible_values.definition: not set

possible_values.name: In Development
possible_values.definition: The product has been announced but is not yet accessible to users, and no further information has been provided.

possible_values.name: Early access
possible_values.definition: It is possible to apply for product access, but access is not guaranteed for all users.

possible_values.name: Open Beta
possible_values.definition: The product is currently being tested and often has a disclaimer.

possible_values.name: Live
possible_values.definition: The product is fully deployed, accessible, and usable by anyone.

possible_values.name: Support Ended
possible_values.definition: The product may still be accessible but is no longer being supported.

possible_values.name: Discontinued
possible_values.definition: The product has been taken offline and is no longer accessable to any user.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.isMainProduc.description: A boolean value indicating whether the product is the Profile's primary or flagship offering.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.launchDate.description: The date when the product was first launched or made publicly available. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.products.supportsProd.description: Lists all the products that this product explicitly supports. This also describes a direction of support, for example a wallet may support a chain, but a chain does not support a wallet. Not used for on-chain deployments.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.name.description: The legal name of the Entity as registered with the relevant regulatory bodies or government agencies.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.tradeName.description: Any additional trading names, brands, or trademarks associated with the Entity, separate from its legal name.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.entityTypes.description: The legal structure or registration category of the Entity (e.g. LLC, Foundation, Corporation).

possible_values.definition: not set

possible_values.name: Foundation
possible_values.definition: An entity that conducts activities without the purpose of generating profit, and is set up as a foundation in its local jurisdiction.

possible_values.name: Corporation
possible_values.definition: A for-profit company in its local jurisdiction that may function as an umbrella entity for other companies. Examples include: LLC, BV, ЗАО, S.R.L. and other commonly known forms of business entity.

possible_values.name: Startup
possible_values.definition: A new, for-profit company in its local jurisdiction that is often building a technology-related product, entering an emerging market, seeking non-traditional funding, or a combination of such activities.

possible_values.name: Goverment Agency
possible_values.definition: A representative or organization that acts on behalf of a nation state’s interests.

possible_values.name: Listed Company
possible_values.definition: A for-profit entity that has successfully issued equity that can be traded on at least one stock exchange.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.dateOfIncorp.description: The date when the Entity was legally registered or incorporated. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD) when possible.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.parentEntity.description: A reference to the parent Entity, if applicable, using the parent Entity's unique identifier or name.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.localRegistr.description: The registration number assigned to the Entity by the relevant regulatory body or government agency, if applicable.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.taxIdentific.description: The unique tax identification number assigned to the Entity by the relevant tax authority, if applicable.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.address.description: The registered physical address of the Entity, including street, city, state/province (if applicable), and postal code.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.country.description: The country in which the Entity is legally registered or incorporated, using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code format.

possible_values.name: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Macedonia, the Former Yugoslav Republic of
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

id.thegrid.tgs-007.entities.leiNumber.description: The Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) code assigned to the Entity by the Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation (GLEIF), if applicable.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.socials.socialType.description: The specific social media platform the URL belongs to (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Discord). Refer to the standardized list of social media platforms.

possible_values.definition: not_set

possible_values.name: Twitter / X
possible_values.definition: Twitter social networking service

possible_values.name: Discord
possible_values.definition: Link to Discord chat service, looks something like https://discord.gg/%handler%

possible_values.name: Facebook
possible_values.definition: Facebook social networking service

possible_values.name: LinkedIn
possible_values.definition: LinkedIn professional networking service

possible_values.name: Telegram
possible_values.definition: Telegram messaging link (like https://t.me/...)

possible_values.name: Warpcast
possible_values.definition: Warpcast service

possible_values.name: GitHub
possible_values.definition: GitHub profile

possible_values.name: GitLab
possible_values.definition: GitLab profile

possible_values.name: Reddit
possible_values.definition: Reddit discussion forum (subreddit)

possible_values.name: Instagram
possible_values.definition: Instagram photo sharing service

possible_values.name: Substack
possible_values.definition: Blogs at substack.com

possible_values.name: YouTube
possible_values.definition: YouTube video channel

possible_values.name: TikTok
possible_values.definition: TikTok account

id.thegrid.tgs-007.socials.name.description: The name or handle associated with the Profile's social media account on the specified platform. This should match the name displayed on the social media profile page.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.tags.name.description: The name of a tag which is a reference to something. This something is defined by its description and type.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.tags.tagTypes.description: A reference to a connected table that contains a type. A type of tag provides some context as to what a tag is and also contains a description.

possible_values.definition: not set

possible_values.name: Event
possible_values.definition: A time-bound gathering, conference, or organized program

possible_values.name: Community
possible_values.definition: A defined group of users, developers, or stakeholders organized around a shared interest or purpose.

possible_values.name: Tech
possible_values.definition: A collection of profiles unified by their use of a specific technology, protocol, or technical standard.

possible_values.name: Geography
possible_values.definition: A grouping based on physical location, jurisdiction, or regional market focus (i.e., a country or city)

possible_values.name: Paradigm
possible_values.definition: A distinct approach, methodology, or philosophical framework and its applications.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.tags.description.description: A description of this tag which provides a short explanation over what this unique tag is about

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContractDeployme.description: Categorizes the type of deployment based on the smart contract’s main purpose. For example, if the contract is primarily used to mint an asset, it will be tagged as ‘mint’.

possible_values.name: not set
possible_values.definition: Not set

possible_values.name: Mint
possible_values.definition: A deployment that creates and manages assets on-chain

possible_values.name: Pool
possible_values.definition: A deployment that makes up a pool, usually in a DEX

possible_values.name: General
possible_values.definition: A general smart contract deployment

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContractDeployme.description: Specifies which blockchain a smart contract is deployed on. If a product or asset does not have a smart contract, meaning it is not deployed on any blockchain, leave this field blank.
The technical standard or protocol specification that the smart contract implements. If the standard cannot be identified, leave this field blank.

possible_values.definition: (not set)

possible_values.name: ERC-20
possible_values.definition: A standard for fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, defining a common set of rules for token implementation to ensure compatibility across the ecosystem.

possible_values.name: BEP-20
possible_values.definition: BEP20 tokens are fungible tokens, based on the popular ERC-20 standard from Ethereum, designed for use on the Binance Smart Chain.f

possible_values.name: SPL
possible_values.definition: The Solana Program Library token standard, used for creating both fungible and non-fungible tokens on the Solana blockchain, offering high speed and low transaction costs.

possible_values.name: ERC-721
possible_values.definition: A standard for non-fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain, allowing for the creation of unique digital assets with distinct properties and ownership rights.

possible_values.name: ERC-1155
possible_values.definition: A multi-token standard on Ethereum that allows for the creation of both fungible and non-fungible tokens within a single smart contract.

possible_values.name: TRC-20
possible_values.definition: The TRON blockchain's equivalent of ERC-20, used for creating fungible tokens on the TRON network.

possible_values.name: ASA
possible_values.definition: Algorand Standard Asset - Algorand's native token standard that supports both fungible and non-fungible tokens.

possible_values.name: FA2
possible_values.definition: Financial Application 2 - Tezos blockchain's unified token contract interface for all token types.

possible_values.name: ERC-777
possible_values.definition: An improved version of the ERC-20 standard on Ethereum, offering additional features like operator management and hooks.

possible_values.name: BEP-2
possible_values.definition: The original token standard for the Binance Chain (not to be confused with Binance Smart Chain).

possible_values.name: Cosmos SDK
possible_values.definition: While not a token standard per se, it's a framework used by many Cosmos-based blockchains to create their native tokens.

possible_values.name: ERC-4626
possible_values.definition: A standard for tokenized vaults on Ethereum, commonly used in DeFi applications.

possible_values.name: PSP22
possible_values.definition: The primary fungible token standard on the Polkadot and Kusama ecosystems.

possible_values.name: spl-token-2022
possible_values.definition: Solana Token 2022 - An upgraded version of the original SPL token standard. The Solana Token 2022 program introduces several new features and improvements over the original SPL token standard, aiming to provide more flexibility and functionality for token

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContracts.deploy.description: The Deployment ID links individual smart contracts to their parent deployment record. A deployment can contain multiple related smart contracts (like a protocol's core contracts), but each blockchain deployment must have its own unique deployment record.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContracts.name.description: The official identifier or label for the smart contract as used in project documentation and blockchain explorers. If no name is given, leave it blank.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContracts.addres.description: The unique blockchain address where the smart contract is deployed. Format must match the relevant blockchain's address structure.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.smartContracts.deploy.description: The date when the smart contract was deployed to the blockchain. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). Note: This will be automated in the future.

id.thegrid.tgs-007.urls.urlType.description: Categorizes the purpose and content of a URL based on its table group in the TGS. The URL type must align with both the content it links to and the context of its parameter group (Profile/Product/Asset/Entity/Social).

possible_values.definition: (not set)

possible_values.name: Main
possible_values.definition: The main URL that is used by the profiles table

possible_values.name: Blog
possible_values.definition: Links to blogs

possible_values.name: Documentation
possible_values.definition: Link to most informative documentation link. Normally the homepage of the docs area or subdomain of a website (Note documentation is used in profile, assets, products, and deployments)

possible_values.name: Whitepaper
possible_values.definition: Links to whitepapers, often in PDF format

possible_values.name: Product
possible_values.definition: The main URL of a product and the best place to access the product.

possible_values.name: Entity
possible_values.definition: The official URL of the entity

possible_values.name: Social
possible_values.definition: A catch-all for social media links

id.thegrid.tgs-007.urls.url.description: This is a URL that links to different types, it must always start with a "http://" or "https://".
